etymologies: late 19th century. From German Agoniadin from Brazilian Portuguese agoniada, the name of the tree from which the substance was first obtained + -in

definitions: A bitter compound obtained from two Amazonian forest trees, Himatanthus lancifolius and H. sucuuba (family Apocynaceae), whose bark and leaves are used in Brazilian folk medicine.

notes.text: Agoniadin is a glucoside of a tricyclic base; C₂₁H₂₆O₁₂.
